title: USD Screams Higher As Month-End Flows Dominate
text:
As we earlier in the week, sometimes month-end flows can come out of nowhere and lead to large, sometimes even exaggerated moves in the market. Friday is/was the last trading day of the month and that could be what we saw as the heads higher.

The USD broke through horizontal resistance at 98.45 earlier and moved right up to the 127% extension level at 98.78, which is the move from the daily highs on august 23 to the lows of the same day. Next target on the upside is the recent high from August 1 at 98.93. Short-term support comes in at the daily low of 98.41.

Source: Tradingview, FOREX.com

As a result of the dollar's move higher, has taken a nose dive, breaking through the August 1 low at 1.1026. EUR/USD has traded the whole month of August in a 225-pips range, between the August 1 low and the August 6 high at 1.1250. Next support comes in at 1.0965, which is the 127% extension from the previously mentioned period.

Source: Tradingview, FOREX.com

Below that is daily trendline support at 1.0940.

Source: Tradingview, FOREX.com

The old support level at 1.1026 now acts as resistance above. Second resistance level is the August 23 lows at 1.1050.

Be careful. As liquidity thins out, volatility could remain.
description: Forex Analysis by Joe Perry covering: EUR/USD, US Dollar Index. Read Joe Perry's latest article on Investing.com
